section.title: Overview
section.para: Module for updating ISUP encapuslated in SIP (SIP-T/SIP-I)
The sipt module can be used to update various ss7 headers contained inside a message.

section.title: Dependencies
section.para:
The module depends on the following modules (in the other words the listed modules must be loaded before this module):
none

updates the IAM in the body if it exists, setting the called party number to destination with the nature address specified in nai and decrementing the hop counter value if present. If the hop counter header is missing it will be added with the value of hops.

example.title: sipt_destination(destination, hops, nai) usage

section.para: updates the first byte of the backward call indicator in the ACM or COT in the body if setting the Charge Indicator to charge_indicator, the Called party's status indicator in called_status, the Called party's category indicator in called_category and the End to End Method Indicator with the value of the value of e2e_indicator.

example.title: sipt_destination(destination, hops, nai) usage
example.programlisting: ... # set bci for charging, subscriber free, ordinary, no e2e available sipt_set_bci_1("2", "1", "1", "0"); ...

section.para: updates the IAM in the body if it exists, setting (or adding) the calling party number to origin with the nature address specified in nai and setting the presentation and screening values to presentation and screening.

example.title: sipt_set_calling(origin, nai, presentation, screening) usage
example.programlisting: ... # update the calling party to the value in the from header sipt_set_calling($fU, 4, 0, 3); ...

section.para: Returns the value of the Address presentation restricted indicator contained in the Calling Party Number header of the IAM message if it exists. Returns -1 if there isn't a Calling Party Number header.

example.title: sipt_presentation pseudo-variable usage

section.para: Returns the value of the Screening Indicator contained in the Calling Party Number header of the IAM message if it exists. Returns -1 if there isn't a Calling Party Number header.

example.title: sipt_screening pseudo-variable usage

section.para: Returns the value of the Hop Counter for the IAM message if it exists. Returns -1 if there isn't a hop counter.

example.title: sipt_hop_counter pseudo-variable usage

section.para: Returns the value of the Calling Party Category for the IAM message. Returns -1 if there is a parsing error.

example.title: sipt_cpc pseudo-variable usage
example.programlisting:
... # get the Cpc code and set put it in a custom sip header append_hf("X-CPC: $sipt(cpc)\r\n");
...

section.para: Returns the value of the Nature of Address Indicator of the Calling Party for the IAM message. Returns -1 if there is a parsing error or if the Calling Party Number is not present.

example.title: sipt_calling_party_nai pseudo-variable usage

section.para: Returns the value of the Nature of Address Indicator of the Called Party for the IAM message. Returns -1 if there is a parsing error.

example.title: sipt_called_party_nai pseudo-variable usage

section.para: Returns the value of the Event Info header of the CPG message. Returns -1 if there is a parsing error.
